text: Do you know the real reason why Jehovah God had smite the Egyptians with 10 plagues? Each plague was designed to attack groups of specific gods.  For example the ninth plague - darkness - attacked Amon-re, Re, Aten, Atum and Horus... all Egyptian sun gods.  The tenth and final plague was a judgment on all of Egypt’s gods, including Pharaoh himself (who was seen as "god on earth"). Earlier in Exodus 1, Pharaoh had killed the sons of Israel. Now in an act of justice Jehovah would kill the firstborn sons of the Egyptians including Pharoah's son.

author: Jesse Acevedo

text: What's funny is that many people are taught this story as though it was real (me and many others). In reality, the exodus from Egypt never occurred. Archaeology has taught us that Moses never existed. We've also learned that the numbers of the story are completely fallacious; claiming three million slaves in Egypt built the pyramids and eventually left with Moses. Turns out, there weren't even three million people on Earth at the time the Pyramids were built and the time this supposedly took place. What is true about Egypt is that the Pyramids were built by workers akin to modern day construction workers and were paid for their services. While slaves were used in Egypt, they were never used in the construction of the Pyramids. Just some interesting information.

text: To banido really God doesn't play favorites. But he shows just how wonderful and powerful he is. He took an extremely small virtually unknown tribe and from that tribe men (namely Moses and Aaron who I hope is given a proper role in this movie) that he knew would be devoted to him. Well as devoted as any man can be (read the book of Exodus and you'll see what I mean lol). He made through them his existence known throughout THE WORLD (well the major kingdoms and empires throughout the region). For now GREATLY known is Israel throughout the world. That's how God works he will take those that are small and humble and he knows will be devoted to him. Then he will do GREAT things with them and through them. He wouldn't choose a foul prideful nation like Egypt (or any great nation). I mean come on the king of Egypt wanted to be worshiped as a god on earth. Never mind the fact that they wouldn't worship the one true living God. They worshiped the sun and slabs of stone really? Also he kills the first born as a FINAL testament to prove that God will now be ignored. Like Israel we can expect many great things from god if we turn to him through Christ. But also like Egypt if we turn away from God and refuse him. We should expect NOTHING less then his WRATH. NO ONE and I mean no one should want to experience his wrath. For it is written that he will not save this world a second time. But save those who seek him through his son. I could go on and on about linage, laws and revelation. But you're smart right? Got it all figure out right? Got too much pride to be wrong RIGHT? Till one day you realize you don't got it all figure out. But by then they'll be closing the casket door on you. We stand on the precipice of eternity. Nough said. -_-

I keep reading about all these epic events, and I dont understand why we keep filming the same stories over and over. I want to see roman soldiers panic at the battle of Cannae. text: Ancient Egyptians were Black/African/Negroid.  Hollywood whitewashes African history because Western audiences can't handle seeing a movie about Blacks in power.  Ancient Egypt began in 3500 B.C.  Ancient Egypt was first invaded by the Hyskos in 1700 B.C. The Hyskos were kicked out 100 years later in 1600 B.C. Ancient Egypt wasn't occupied again until 728 B.C. by The Nubians (modern day Sudan). Then the Assyrians (outsiders) came next, followed by The Persians, then the Greeks, then the Romans at the turn of the millennium (30 B.C.) Finally, the Arabs conquered Egypt indefinitely in 642 A.D.  The people you see in Egypt today are NOT the people who lived there 5,000 years ago.   The Egypt that the entire world is fascinated by.....the PEAK/PRIME period of Ancient Egypt was the New Kingdom (King Tut, Ahmose, Amenhotep, Hatshepsut).....this period was from 1600 BC to 1000 BC.....1000 years before Europeans came and 2,000 years before Arabs came. THEY WERE BLACK. DEAL WITH IT.

author: Manas Surya

text: Why I'm Excited For EXODUS: GODS AND KINGS (my opinion):  1. Fantastic cast of character actors - Christian Bale, Joel Edgerton, John Turturro, Aaron Paul, Sigourney Weaver, Ben Mendelsohn, Ben Kingsley.  2. Ridley Scott is a great director who can direct actors incredibly well, and has a beautiful and detailed visual style that I think can help make translate this story for the big screen for this new decade, despite his last decade of films being not good (cough *Robin Hood* cough).  3. Steven Zallian (writer of SCHINDLER'S LIST and THE GIRL WITH THE DRAGON TATTOO American Remake) is the main screenwriter of the film, and so far from these films, he's a incredible screenwriter who can do no wrong as long as he has a great director to adapt and translate it well to the screen, that being Ridley Scott.  4. It's another film adaptation of the Exodus from the bible. Right now, it think it's an appropriate time for another live-action adaptation of it. Even if you're not into the bible, you have to admit that the story is really epic and entertaining, which is why I think it's one of the most adapted stories on the screen. In this decade, not counting any television series or animated film adaptations, it would be nice to see how the story is adapted, updated, and translated with new technology, actors, and crew. Even if the movie isn't good, you could tell the actors and filmmakers are trying to tell a good story with something we've seen so many times. And finally, we still have THE TEN COMMANDMENTS and THE PRINCE OF EGYPT, two already mind-blowing film adaptations of the source material with different takes on the tale, yet still keeping what made the story so great to begin with, the epic scale, the conflict between every single character, and the moral decisions characters face to do what they think is right, whether it's good or bad, and for the better or worst.

text: well, I do understand the race argument, but it is an American movie intended mostly for American audiences. What I mean by that is the majority of American actors happen to be white, because statistically the majority of Americans are white and English speaking. So the pool of actors to choose from while casting are mostly white. If Japan made a Japanese version of this, then of course the actors would be Japanese. If Bollywood made a version, the actors would be Indian. I do understand the argument being made, though, and more diversity would be better. I think what went on here is that Christian Bale and Joel Edgerton were cast because they're really big in America and appeal to American audiences. There just isn't a big pool of Arabic actors to choose from in America to headline a movie, for better or for worse.

text: Southern Egypt today is inhabited by people we know call 'BLACK AFRICAN.' (Black is an  ambiguous  term used to refer to a vast array of peoples who in antiquity and sometimes today, mainly inhabited Africa, Southern Arabia and the southern rim of Asia from Iran to China, as well as Australia). For colonial purposes, the british sowed confusion by calling the Southern Egyptians 'Nubians.' They are not the original Nubians/ Kushites. They are partially the people who remained in Egypt after other peoples moved in and partially ancient Nubian/ Kushite/ Cushite. The Nubians of the days of Ancient Egypt are the ancestors of a very dark people who are also very tall and smooth-skinned, that today, are known by various names like Dinka, Fur, Shilluk, Nuba among others. That is why they are DEPICTED slightly DIFFERENTLY FROM OTHER AFRICANS in  Ancient  Egyptian drawings particularly as very dark, primarily jet-black. Today, Northern Egypt, really, the rim along the Mediterannean Sea, is mostly inhabited by people who are mixed Arab and African, pure Arabs, and Mixes between ancient Greeks, Persians, Romans, Arabs, Africans and Turks (Egypt much later became a colony of the Ottoman chiefdom).
author: Djoser Django

text: Back to the movie though, the king during Moses' time was NOT Ramesses. Or, as he was known in  ancient Africa and Persia, Riamashesha. Ramesses is the Greek transliteration of his name.

text: i'm tired of all those black and White MTF screeming its a black/White history first of all Africa is NOT a country !! Two They never where black !!! And We North africans don't belong to Black and White people !!! Here is a DNA test of ancient egyptians mummy's and egyptians today !!!!!! Don't kill your self x)   Main article: DNA history of Egypt Contamination from handling and intrusion from microbes create obstacles to the recovery of ancient DNA. Consequently, most DNA studies have been carried out on modern Egyptian populations with the intent of learning about the influences of historical migrations on the population of Egypt.  In general, various DNA studies have found that the gene frequencies of modern North African populations are intermediate between those of the Near East, southern Europe and Sub Saharan Africa, though the frequency distributions of the non-recombining portion of the Y chromosome of modern Egyptian population appear to be much more similar to those of the Middle East than to any sub-Saharan African population, suggesting a much larger Eurasian genetic component.  Blood typing and DNA sampling on ancient Egyptian mummies is scant; however, blood typing of dynastic mummies found ABO frequencies to be most similar to modern Egyptians and some also to Northern Haratin populations. ABO blood group distribution shows that the Egyptians form a sister group to North African populations, including Berbers, Nubians and Canary Islanders.

text: This movie is completely racially inaccurate but so are many of the comments here. The Ancient Egyptians were not Black or White. The ancient Egyptians were a people classified as "Berber" people. They are the aboriginal Caucasian people of North Africa. Caucasian, by the way, in the traditional sense has nothing to do with skin colour but bone structure. East Africans, for example, are Black but are still Caucasian. Today they call themselves the Coptic people and the Coptic people are the true descendants of Egyptians.  Here's a picture: http://www.bing.com/images/search?q=Coptic+peoples&FORM=HDRSC2#view=detail&id=3B46CB93F4CCA655D3706EB7BF28560D2A1ADBEB&selectedIndex=12

text: What most people are overlooking is that the cast needed to have racial consistency. Since Moses didn't realise the fact that he was hebrew until well into his life, we can safely assume there was little disparity in looks between egyptians and jews. Therefore, you cannot cast a caucasian actor to play Moses and then cast a black actor as Ramses and his parents. Even an all-black casting, as some proposed, would've raised a big fuss (even bigger than this), because then, jews would be played by black actors. The lack of ethnic variety in Hollywood's stars is always something to be lamented, but when a studio's spending $150+million on a project like this, you can understand why they decided to go with established, white actors. Hopefully, in the future, things will be different. However, all this controversy aside, I am very much looking forward to seeing this.

text: Just some Info about the exodus to those who search for truth.  When Moses led the people across the red sea, they stopped at a place that had 12 wells of water and 72 palm trees. Why in the world would this be recorded? it seems like a useless fact. and besides who would count the palm trees? this seems stupid until you go back and find that there were 12 brothers and 72 people who went down to Egypt upon the invitation of the pharaoh nearly 300 years earlier.  If the bible were made up by various authors, why in the world would they include these almost seemingly useless details? It was a sign to the people traveling out of Egypt that they were on the correct path, so they recorded it on paper. or papyrus to be specific. and Moses who was most likely, the only one who knew how to read and write, did the recording.  These seemingly useless facts are replete throughout the bible. people who only read the surface never see these connections. and thus it is written "Seeing, they do not see. Hearing, they do not hear."  another such connection? the people wandered 40 years after they crossed the red sea. Jesus wandered the wilderness 40 days directly after his baptism.  another such connection? the people tested God 3 times in the dessert. Jesus was tested 3 times in the wilderness by Satan.  They go on, and on, and on. The most significant is the placement of the furniture in the sanctuary and the wounds that Jesus received on his body.  does this make sense to anyone here?  If you doubt the authenticity of the bible, read psalm 22 and then read the story of Jesus crucified. Matthew 27, then read psalm 22 again. OPEN YOUR EYES PEOPLE. be still and know that God is near. He is even at the door knocking.

text: Historical errors in this trailer: 1. Its in English. 2. Armor and military equipment are of later time periods (for example steel swords, Romanesque armor of Moses, the use of armored mounted cavalry, using cloth pennants, etc.). 3. The architecture is far to large expansive for the Egypt at the time of the traditional dates the Exodus has been estimated to have taken place. 4. The brief depiction of the Israelite slaves in the pit is an extreme exaggeration of the slavery of Israel (which some historians claim may have been more akin to a client state than slavery itself). 5. Moses, as the adopted son of the daughter of Pharaoh, would have never been so close to Ramses, or likely have called him brother. 6. Biblical records portray the personalities of Moses and Ramses very differently than how they appear here (Moses is not outspoken possibly shy, and Ramses is confident and shrewd). 7. Most traditional and Biblical scholars/historians agree that the sea that the Israelites crossed is the Reed Sea (which is extinct) not the Red Sea. 8. Every bit of dialogue, and every movement of each and every character has no evidence to support that this took place exactly as depicted. Yet, all we can find to complain about is the fact that is the actors are all white? I mean if Ridley Scott hired dark skinned black men to play the role, how would we know if their skin was too dark? Or if Hispanic's skin is too light? Was he suppose to hold auditions in Egypt, and have each actor hold their hand to the hieroglyphs and match the color of the Egyptians as portrayed? If you go into a film looking for historical accuracy then honestly you will never find a good film. I understand wanting to have some ethnic diversity, but don't make it like some monumental historical sin. I just want it to be entertaining, engaging, thought provoking, and bring something new to the table when discussing the Exodus story. I am NOT going to see it in theaters though, cause the risk/reward ratio of seeing it on the big screen has the risks in much greater favor.

text: The number of racist black people on here makes me sad.  The Egyptians were not black. They were Mediterranean, which was quite pale in comparison to Africans. Skin colour ran a gambit in Egyptian territory, but the ruling elite were by no means black.  The Hebrews were darker skinned than, say, an Irishman, but they were not black, either. They were a Semitic people whose ancestry is shared with the Arab. Tan skin, not black. The Semitic peoples were descended from Europeans and had far paler skin than the Africans.  This movie isn't racist. People claiming it is racist? Definitely racist.

text: All this arguing is completely ridiculous, but I'll put my two cents in, nonetheless. I really don't understand why everyone gets so angry with each other as soon as something religious pops up. As a Christian, I believe that Jesus told us to love everybody. Every single person. He didn't say "only treat people that believe the same thing you do with respect."  So other Christians, for the love of God, stop spreading hate. Don't act like you're better than others just because you believe in God. Don't tell them crap like they're stupid or evil for not believing in God. You're never going to show them Jesus's love for them that way. And please get your facts straight. I've really had enough of cringing at people's comments that try to argue against things like evolution without understanding it. Show people love, guys. I know you can. Just try to see everyone the way that God sees them; as people worthy of love.   And atheists, I'm not going to bully you and tell you you're going to hell. I have no right to say things like that. In the end, that's God's decision. But I would ask that you get your facts straight as well. All these mean arguments start because a lack of understanding. Don't make assumptions based on what you think you know. A little research never hurt anyone. If you don't believe in God, I'm not going to say that's fine, because it'd would overjoy me for everyone to of know God's love. But I don't think anyone was ever saved by being screamed at and talked down to. I'll pray for you, those who read this far and especially those that didn't. If that upsets you, I'm sorry, but honestly I don't think being prayed for by someone you don't know is going to do you any harm either.

text: There is a severe amount of butt hurt going on because of a trailer...does it really matter what skin tone the movie portrays if (as it seems patently clear to me) modern scholarship cannot decide with any degree of accuracy whether the "Egyptians" were of African, Hebrew or European origin. Don't crucify me for this youtube its an opinion. Also there are barely three - four actors shown in detail - hardly a detailed demographic of Egyptian culture. If one looks at the anthropological studies conducted on Egyptian remains from the time period - its clear that they were neither one nor the other. Tut's skull for example bears hallmarks of African and Middle-Eastern racial characteristics thus making skin (and eye) colour an unknown quality. If one looks to wall frescos and paintings - a wide range of tan colours are shown along with very pale white skin for goddesses and high ranking nobles - this most likely demonstrates their social standing rather than racial orientation - pale skin = less time spent working in the fields under the boiling hot sun. Whilst I would hesitate to say anything definitive on youtube - I will spell one thing out: we have no definitive proof of skin, hair or eye colour for "Ancient Egyptians" of the period shown above so quit whining and enjoy the movie.

text: While the Prince of Egypt will always hold this story's place in my heart, I'll give this movie a shot. High hopes, but low expectations though. Just because today, it makes more sense to play things safe and extreme. The Prince of Egypt took risks and took it's time.   Compare the scene of "brotherhood" in this trailer and the animated film. In the Prince of Egypt, Moses and Ramesses have a chariot race, get scolded by Pharaoh, and then talk about their problems alone. Here, they clash swords and smile. Yeah, real fraternal! (sarcasm) My point is the kind of pacing and tact this story requires is a rarely done right, and not just in modern times. The Ten Commandments made the two enemies from near the beginning. This movie seems to be trying to have it's cake and eat it.  The casting is also a little wonky. Mainly on Christian Bale as Moses. When I picture Moses, I of course think of the Prince of Egypt version, someone who started out petulant and immature but grew into his leadership. Then again, there's the Moses of the Ten Commandments played by Charlton Heston who was one of the greatest actors of all time. Bale can be a badass, but I don't see him as much of a leader. Moses was strong but he was also patient. Think of him like Optimus Prime, he doesn't need to raise his voice, but even when he speaks softly his words have such command to them. Bale might offer up a different interpretation but he's got some big sandals to fill.  Lastly, I do feel this isn't exactly the right time to release this movie, you could have shot, edited it, and everything; but perhaps delayed it's actual release for a couple years. It saddens me deeply that religious worship, and media centering around it thereof, receives such venom by most people. (I'm not speaking of those who simply respectively aren't religious as you certainly don't need to be to enjoy the story, but those who are wrathfully anti-practice.) All this movie would do is give more fuel to their fire. Again, the Prince of Egypt allowed us to see God's mercy and love through both Moses' love of his brother and the happiness he found in Midian as well as His power through the Burning Bush, plagues, parting of the sea, etc. This movie seems to be gearing again for the Ten Commandment's fire and brimstone interpretation. Back to my original point, because it's "safer" to go that route rather than attempt at any kind of risky majesty or gentleness.  Now I still will likely see this movie, just hoping that it will exceed my expectations.

text: MY GOODNESS PEOPLE!!! IT"S A MOVIE, FOR CRYING OUT LOUD!!!! There is absolutely nothing at all, whatsoever that says anything about the historical accuracy of the people, events, etc that took place. It has nothing to do with "white vs black" or "fiction vs nonfiction" or "my religion is better than yours" or "you're stupid for being such-n-such religion". It's called entertainment. A MOVIE with ACTORS and SPECIAL EFFECTS for nothing more than the concept of our ENTERTAINMENT. Stop taking everything so seriously and just enjoy a fun story. Please. You don't see this kind of "I hate you 'cause you're such-n-such color" or "follow such-n-such religion" in The Hobbit, or Dracula Untold, or Dumb and Dumber, or anything from the Marvel stories. Why should the Hollywood-twisted story of the Exodus in the Christian Bible bring out so much hate? IT'S A MOVIE!!!

text: A lot of people are complaining that the roles of these people are played by fair-skinned actors. While I completely agree that it makes no historical sense, there are other more glaring things in these period pieces that NO ONE ever complains about; namely, the language used in the movie.  If we're talking about representing the ancient Hebrew/Egyptian culture...Why are these people speaking English to begin with? If it's authenticity we're striving for, we need to be consistent all the way. You can't just complain about the physical appearance and neglect the other hickups.  I wish there would be someone other than Mel Gibson who's willing to finally use the original languages of the periods that are being represented in these movies. Subtitles aren't the devil. People can read.

If you believe in the Bible, then you believe in Goodness (whatever it is) and that Evil is rid by people rising above the muck of human experience and being good themselves. The message of Jesus Christ is not hate nor retaliation, it is forgiveness and love.  Enough of this hate between people. Africa is a mass of land that is given a name and the boundaries were conventionally given to what is conventionally called a continent. In the process, they included Arabic (AKA Semitic) countries within that conventionally so called continent. In different areas are different group of people in that continent. The darkest group of people on that land mass live in the West. They are not just Black, but they have full lips, big nose for the most part, and a couple other physical characteristics common to themselves particularly. To the East there are the Ethiopians, Somalians etc... who are a completely ethnic group, with completely different physical characteristics. They have dark skins too, but not nearly as dark as the West Africans. To the South, you originally had the same people than the West until the Anglos came and occupied them. Anglos just love conquest and to bring destruction on people around the world but that's not the discussion here. To the North you have the Arabs and there are many countries of them such as Morocco, Libya _the country Pres. Obama [another Anglo, mind you] destroyed_  and so on. You also have the people in what is known as Horn of Africa. I don't expect Afrocentric people to know about it, but there people there, although dark, they don't look like the West Africans.  Why I put so much emphasis on West Africans? text: Modern Egyptians Have Absolutely NOTHING to do with Ancient Egyptians.......Let's give the Math and the Science Scholarly Facts..... Modern Egyptian population is not representative of the ancients "Cosmopolitan, North and South Egypt is less likely to have  a population representative of the core indigenous population of the most ancient times“ – Keita 2005. History in Africa, 2005, 32(1).221-246 "Outside influence and admixture with extraregional groups primarily occurred in Lower Egypt—perhaps during the later dynastic periods, but especially in Ptolmaic and Roman times”  -Irish 2009. Dental_affinities_of_the_C-group_inhabitants.. Ec Hi Rev Modern Egyptians a mixed population with European and Arab strands-not identical to ancients: “Classical genetic studies show a high degree of genetic heterogeneity in the modern Egyptian population, suggesting that this population is descended from a mixture of African, Asian, and Arabian stock (Mahmoud et al. 1987; Hafez et al. 1986). Genetic heterogeneity within the Egyptian gene pool is also supported by more recent studies using autosomal STR markers (Klintschar et al. 1998; 2001)." ---Manni et al 2002. Y-chromosome analysis in Egypt, Hum Bio, 74:5, 645-658 Many of today’s Egyptians are not necessarily representative of Ancients due to outside migration and admixture from European/Arab sources, particularly in Lower Egypt. Some Coptic claims to be pharanoic descendants not supported by DNA studies or cultural history showing heavy Arabization since 900 AD Modern Copt genetic profile shows substantial Middle Eastern and European elements: [quote:] " The bulk of genetic diversity appears to be a consequence of recent migrations and demographic events mainly from Asia and Europe, evident in a higher migration rate for speakers of Afro-Asiatic as compared with the Nilo-Saharan family of languages, and a generally higher effective population size for the former... The current communities are known to be largely the product of recent migrations from Egypt over the past two centuries..“  ---Hassan et al. 2008. Y-chromosome variation.." Am J. Phy An. v137,3. 316-323 Who are they Like?? Nubians are related to ancient Egyptians... "Studies of cranial morphology also support the use of a Nubian (Kerma) population for a comparison of the Dynastic period, as this group is likely to be more closely genetically related to the early Nile valley inhabitants than would be the Early and Late Dynastic Egyptians, who likely experienced significant mixing with other Mediterranean populations (Zakrzewski, 2002). A craniometric study found the Naqada and Kerma populations to be morphologically similar (Keita, 1990). Given these and other prior studies suggesting continuity (Berry et al., 1967; Berry and Berry, 1972), and the lack of archaeological evidence of major migration or population replacement during the Neolithic transition in the Nile valley, we may cautiously interpret the dental health changes over time as primarily due to ecological, subsistence, and demographic changes experienced throughout the Nile valley region."  -Starling & Stock 2007. Dental indicators of health.. AJPA 134: 520-28- The Science and DNA....(Using Figure Below) Genetic Analysis of Amarna Mummies Geographical analysis of the Amarna mummies was performed using their autosomal STR profiles based on 8 tested loci.4 Results are summarized in Table 1 and illustrated in Figure 1. Maps for  individual Amarna mummies are included in Figures 2-8 in the Appendix. Discussion: Average MLI scores in Table 1 indicate the STR profiles of the Amarna mummies would be most frequent in present day populations of SEVERAL AFRICAN regions: including the Southern African  (average MLI 326.94), African Great Lakes (average MLI 323.76), and Tropical West African (average MLI 83.74) regions.  These regional matches indicate an exclusively African ancestry for the pharaonic family. The, results indicate these ancient individuals inherited that today are more frequent in populations of Africa than in other parts of the world (such as D18S51=19 and D21S11=34). Conclusion Results indicated the autosomal STR profiles of the Ancient period mummies were most frequent in modern populations in several parts of AFRICA. These results are based on the 8 STR markers for which these pharaonic mummies have been tested, which allow a preliminary geographical analysis for these individuals who lived in Egypt during the Amarna period of the 14th century BCE, and thenceforth  Results suggest exclusively African ancestry, geographical analysis suggests ancestral links with neighboring populations in Africa for the studied pharaonic mummies. Sources: DNA Tribes Digest January 1, 2012 Egypt Search Reloaded Encyclopedia of the Archaeology of Ancient Egypt, ed. Kathryn A. Bard and Steven Blake Shubert, ( London and New York: Routledge, 1999)

text: According to the Bible's chronology Thutmose III would actually be the Pharaoh of the Exodus, well either him or his step mother. We have historical records of a Pharaoh by the name of Shosinque who invaded Canaan in the year 925BC. In the book of 1 Kings, it says that "In the fifth year of King Rehoboam's reign, King Shishak(Shosinque) of Egypt came up and attacked Jerusalem."  So that brings us to 930BCE. 1 Kings says Solomon ruled for 40 years and that in the fourth year of his reign he built the Temple. So now we are at 966BCE. 1 Kings says that the temple was built 480 years after the Exodus. so that means the Exodus occurred at about 1446BCE during the reign of Thutmose III or possibly his stepmother Hatshepsut, whom was document as one of most prolific builders in ancient Egypt . According to the book of Exodus, Moses was 80 years old when he spoke with the Pharaoh of the Exodus, meaning that in 1526 the Pharaoh of the Oppression was Ahmose I, the pharaoh who drove the Semitic Hyksos out of Egypt.

text: The reason most Moses movies depict pharaoh as Ramasses is because the Bible says the Israelites built the city of Rameses, so people try to connect the two. But the Bibles timeline puts the exodus  around the 1485 B.C.  time frame. well before Ramesses II drew his first breath. text: personally, I think that all the ignorant and naive individuals need to stop believing that once a person proclaims their faith in God and conducts certain rituals in order to demonstrate their beliefs, that does not make their way absolute and final. For example, if a religious person believes that homosexuals should not get married because such a union does not exist in the Bible (or other holy book), that does not mean that religions, such as Christianity, forsake the very idea. There are many altruistic ideas and moral doctrines that can be extrapolated from holy books that supersede such hateful acts such as banning same sex marriage, or inequities between genders. It matters not whether the events told in holy books have occurred. What matters is whether society has the ability to read between the lines and take from holy books, teachings that can actually make a positive impact in someones life.

text: MOSE / MESES / MOSHE = SON OF. There was never a man in Khemet (sounds like Hammet for the land of HAM) named Moses, an abandoned baby floating down the Nile, brought home and raised in the royal house and nobody asked "wtf this baby come from?" Second, the only man in actual recorded Egyptian history to ever change the religion of the state, the only man to have that power position to do so, was Pharaoh Amenhotep IV aka AKHENANTEN (Ankh-en-Aten) circa 1350-1335 b.c.e., 18th Dynasty. That's the one the Moses character was loosely based on. His grandfather was Yuya (the real Joseph), Grand Vizier to Akheneten's father Amenhotep III. Akhenten's mother Queen Tiye, is CLEARLY ETHIOPIAN / SUDANESE in appearance and features. I've never in my life, seen a white man with lips as big,  nostrils as flared, chin elongated as Akhenaten is depicted.

As for the similar look between blacks (only applies to _some_ light skinned American blacks) and Egyptians, well you can thank your native American heritage for that. Before your pure African genes got mixed with native American genes, which share similar traits with Egyptians, you looked just like your native African brethren. text: If they don't show in the movie that God spoke to 3 millon jews at Mount Sinai that movie is not telling you the truth.  Mass revelation God created only one miraculous, mass event: He gave the Torah to about three million Jews at Mount Sinai. Amidst a mountain burning "unto the heart of the heavens", all witnesses heard intelligent speech emanating from those flames. "I will come to you in a thick cloud, so that all the people will hear when I speak to you. They will also then believe in you forever." (Exodus 19:9) When Moses recounts the event to the people he says, "Teach your children and your children's children about the day you stood before God your Lord at Horeb. It was then that God said to me, "Congregate the people for Me, and I will let them hear my words. This will teach them to be in awe of Me as long as they live on earth, and they will also teach their children." (Deuteronomy 4:9-10) "You are the ones who have been shown, so that you will know that God is the Supreme Being and there is none besides Him. From the heavens, He let you hear His voice admonishing you, and on earth He showed you His great fire, so that you heard His words from the fire." "The Israelites saw the great power that God had unleashed against Egypt, and the people were in awe of God. They believed in God and his servant Moses."  "Face to face, God spoke with you..." The Torah also states: "God did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us ― who are all here alive today." (Deut. 5:3) [Moses told the Israelites]: 'Only beware for yourself and greatly beware for your soul, lest you forget the things that your eyes have beheld. Do not remove this memory from your heart all the days of your life. Teach your children and your children's children about the day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horev [Mount Sinai]... God spoke to you from the midst of the fire, you were hearing the sound of words, but you were not seeing a form, only a sound. He told you of His covenant, instructing you to keep the Ten Commandments, and He inscribed them on two stone tablets.' (Deut.4:9-13) 'You have been shown in order to know that God, He is the Supreme Being. There is none besides Him. From heaven he let you hear His voice in order to teach you, and on earth He showed you His great fire, and you heard His words amid the fire.' (Deut. 4:32-36) Moses called all of Israel and said to them: 'Hear, O Israel, the decrees and the ordinances that I speak in your ears today ― learn them, and be careful to perform them. The Lord your God sealed a covenant with us at Horev [Mount Sinai]. Not with our forefathers did God seal this covenant, but with us ― we who are here, all of us alive today. Face to face did God speak with you on the mountain from amid the fire.' (Deut. 5:1-4)

text: Many people mythicize the narrations of the bible. When read carefully the natural explanation is within the narrative, its all in how you view it. From the eyes of the charters within a world where nearly every natural phenomenon was viewed as a supernatural event everything was miracle. With careful reading I believe God was the same yesterday today and tomorrow and the events of his interaction with us are still viewed with the eyes of faith. One thought; do you ever wonder why the mixed multitudes were so quick to grumble ? If the miracles were as plain as modern movies make them, how quick the vision went away. Read the parting of the Red Sea (Sea of Reeds)  carefully, and understand the east wend blew all night and the Israelites crossed on a sand bar probably during an extremely low tide and  the Roman chariots chased them, when the chariots pursued they got stuck, taking off the wheels they continued but the water came up and they drowned probably due to the wearing of heavy armor as well as ancient people didn't know how to swim. Is that still a miracle ? To me its a believable story that doesn't have to transcend the natural world. Their were, and are, many miracles like this to this day. There was not a fantasy world sometime in the past.  But God does causes his plan to ultimately come to pass using the environment he created. Understanding the purpose and meaning in a modern world of the biblical accounts of Jacobs history must be understood in light of the New Testament, and with the understanding of the ancient cosmology as well as viewed through the eyes that wrote it.

text: Since there are so many myths and half-truths being spread, here is a mostly unbiased summary of the whole ancient Egyptian "race" issue based on the last few decades of evidence-based research by Egyptologists:  Egypt was not originally one kingdom, but was originally two kingdoms. Lower Egypt (northern Egypt) was inhabited by brown-skinned people we'd today call "Middle-Eastern". Upper Egypt (southern Egypt) was inhabited by black-skinned people we today call "Nubians" (who resemble Sudanese and Somalis in appearance).  Around 3100 BC, Upper Egypt expanded northwards and conquered Lower Egypt, creating the unified kingdom of Egypt. The first dynasty were Upper Egyptians (i.e. black "Nubians") but many later dynasties were from Lower Egypt (i.e. brown "Middle-Easterners").  In other words, the idea that Egyptians were just a single "race" (whether "black" or "Middle-Eastern") is a myth. Egypt was, in fact, the world's first multi-ethnic, "multi-racial" civilization. And over time, both Upper and Lower Egyptians eventually merged into a single Egyptian identity. As a result, we see wall paintings where Egyptians clearly distinguish themselves from their neighbours, lighter than Nubians but darker than Syrians & Lybians.  Another myth is the idea that modern Egyptians are Arab invaders, which is nonsense. In Roman Egypt, there are hundreds of Fayyum mummy paintings demonstrating that Egyptians in Roman times looked hardly any different to Egyptians today, centuries before any Arabs went to Egypt. And those Fayyum mummies are genetically similar to both ancient Egyptians in Ramses' time and modern Egyptians today. The majority of Egyptians today are mostly descended from ancient Lower Egyptians, while Egypt's Nubian minority today are mostly descended from ancient Upper Egyptians.  However, one thing we can agree on is that there were, most definitely, no white-skinned Egyptians in ancient times. The only "white people" in Egypt at the time of Ramses would have been a very small number of Greek "Sea Peoples" whose presence in Egypt was mostly limited to being either slaves or pirates, i.e. among the lower classes. The only time Greeks ever became Pharaohs was after Alexander's conquest a thousand years after Ramses. However, the genetic contribution of both Greeks and Arabs to the modern Egyptian gene pool was very small, and mostly limited to a few major cities, like Cairo and Alexandria.

text: The country of Egypt is in the continent of Africa. Which means black people period, especially during the time this film is suppose to be depicting. Prior to the region being overran by first the Greeks, the Romans and later the Arabs, the indigenous people were of darker skin tones. The ancient Egyptians had always considered their people of the upper Nile were blessed by the gods, which are those people who came from Sudan and perhaps Ethiopia.   Of course, there were lighter skinned (brown colored) people in these areas based on relationships with other ethnicities, but there were no white people at all in these areas during this particular era until hundreds or perhaps thousands of years later.   History has always been written by those who are victorious. So therefore, it is absolutely natural to believe that Egypt has always been of Arab ethnicity but that does not make it true and the same can be said about the other countries along the northern region of the continent. Hell, the name Egypt was what the Greeks called the country and it stuck, but those who lived there called Egypt, Kemet. Just like Ethiopia was called Kush prior to the Greeks killing rampage.

text: RIDLEY SCOTT – EXODUS GODS AND KINGS– 2014  First of all, for a remake, it is rather well done because the director decided to get rid of the most obvious unrealistic elements. To be short on the subject he got rid of all the static scenes like the waiting of the Jews to start for their migration outside the city, the never ending wait for Moses to come back down with the tables, the golden calf and the breaking of the tables, etc.   Then he tried to make things slightly more realistic, including with an Egyptian doctor explaining us how the various plagues are nothing but a processing phenomenon: a rebellion of crocodile make the river bloody and kills the fish that rot away bringing crop failure, worms and flies and then some kind of skin infections. But he finally had to come to less natural things: the locusts, well maybe, but then the hail in the storm became frankly iffy, and the final touch of the death of the first born was desperately mysterious and then we reached at this moment the problem of faith.  The escape sounds more logical in a way but the crossing of the sea was of course not explainable. We knew there was a ford but Moses goofed and took the road he did not know so that he did not come to the ford. Then we had to believe the water went down all by itself and then the tsunami was natural. Once again we came across the necessity to believe.   The alternative is of course to take this film as an action film. I must say Scott did a pretty job thanks to some very hard scenes like the hanging of hostages every day. But then one question comes up. The Hebrews or Jews had been slaves in Egypt for four hundred years. That brings us back around 2000 years BEFORE our era. So how did these Jews become slaves in Egypt since Judaism did not exist yet since Moses had not intervened with their fate yet? Were they Jews before Judaism or did they invent Judaism in slavery? Where did they come from anyway?   But most of all this film is speaking to us directly in the situation we have been living in for some 15 years now, at least. This world, I mean the western world as confronted to the rest of the world and particularly the Muslim world, has been managing the three main religions of our times, the three religions that were born in the Middle East from Semitic traditions, Judaism, Christianity and Islam, by imposing secularism to them all, the French going a lot farther than the English or the Germans. As long as we do not recognize the people around us as equal in the totality of their existential personalities, including their religions we are pushing them into some kind of mobilization against this secularism and hence against the norms of the west.  In France we became hysterical about “marriage for all” which excludes by the way any other solution than marriage: “everyone has to get married” is implied, and that formula was there to cover same sex marriage or gay marriage. Not to use the word gay or homosexual they got into that phrase and that provoked the Christians mostly into demonstrating for “A family for everyone.” In the same way anti-Semitism and the obligation for Jews not to show their religion in public places like schools, hospitals or social services, some are moving towards emigrating and becoming extreme Zionists. In the same way finally the Muslims being ordered to hide their religious heritage away from all public places including streets and train stations they are pushed into becoming fundamentalists.   If you negate the essence of a person, that person is going to move towards those who are acknowledging that essence, recognizing it and even valorizing it.  That is shown so well in the film. The Jews are refused basic recognition and humanity as Jews since they are not Egyptians and they are slaves (where did they come from?), then they will support any extreme action, be it from some men or from God. You may say “shibboleth since God does not exist,” like the French extreme secular supporters pretend. Then we saw this week the result in Paris (remember 01/07-08-09/14, and there is no reason for not more to come.   Fundamentalist secularists are just as dangerous as the fundamentalists of any religion because that extreme secularism is a fundamentalist religion, end the worst of them all since it has no God. In France they have “republican values.” What’s that frankly apart from “secularism” + “sexual multi-orientation for everyone”?  That film is a masterpiece.   Dr Jacques COULARDEAU

text: 9	And has there come to you the story of Moosa (Moses)?	 10	When he saw a fire, he said to his family: "Wait! Verily, I have seen a fire, perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom, or find some guidance at the fire."	 11	And when he came to it (the fire), he was called by name: "O Moosa (Moses)!	 12	"Verily! I am your Lord! So take off your shoes, you are in the sacred valley, Tuwa.	 13	"And I have chosen you. So listen to that which is inspired to you.	 14	"Verily! I am Allah! La ilaha illa Ana (none has the right to be worshipped but I), so worship Me, and perform AsSalat (Iqamat-as-Salat) for My Remembrance.	 15	"Verily, the Hour is coming and My Will is to keep it hidden that every person may be rewarded for that which he strives.	 16	"Therefore, let not the one who believes not therein (i.e. in the Day of Resurrection, Reckoning, Paradise and Hell, etc.), but follows his own lusts, divert you therefrom, lest you perish.	 17	"And what is that in your right hand, O Moosa (Moses)?"	 18	He said: "This is my stick, whereon I lean, and wherewith I beat down branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses."	 19	(Allah) said: "Cast it down, O Moosa (Moses)!"	 20	He cast it down, and behold! It was a snake, moving quickly.	 21	Allah said:"Grasp it, and fear not, We shall return it to its former state,	 22	"And press your (right) hand to your (left) side, it will come forth white (and shining), without any disease as another sign,	 23	"That We may show you (some) of Our Greater Signs.	 24	"Go to Firaun (Pharaoh)! Verily, he has transgressed (all bounds in disbelief and disobedience, and has behaved as an arrogant, and as a tyrant)."	 25	(Moosa (Moses)) said: "O my Lord! Open for me my chest (grant me self-confidence, contentment, and boldness).	 26	"And ease my task for me;	 27	"And make loose the knot (the defect) from my tongue, (i.e. remove the incorrectness from my speech) (That occurred as a result of a brand of fire which Moosa (Moses) put in his mouth when he was an infant). (Tafsir At-Tabaree, Vol. 16, Page 159).	 28	"That they understand my speech,	 29	"And appoint for me a helper from my family,	 30	"Haroon (Aaron), my brother;	 31	"Increase my strength with him,	 32	"And let him share my task (of conveying Allahs Message and Prophethood),	 33	"That we may glorify You much,	 34	"And remember You much,	 35	"Verily! You are of us Ever a Well-Seer."	 36	Allah said: "You are granted your request, O Moosa (Moses)!	 37	"And indeed We conferred a favour on you another time (before).	 38	"When We inspired your mother with that which We inspired.	 39	"Saying: Put him (the child) into the Taboot (a box or a case or a chest) and put it into the river (Nile), then the river shall cast it up on the bank, and there, an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his shall take him. And I endued you with love from Me, in order that you may be brought up under My Eye,	 40	"When your sister went and said: Shall I show you one who will nurse him? So We restored you to your mother, that she might cool her eyes and she should not grieve. Then you did kill a man, but We saved you from great distress and tried you with a heavy trial. Then you stayed a number of years with the people of Madyan (Midian). Then you came here according to the fixed term which I ordained (for you), O Moosa (Moses)!	 41	"And I have Istanatuka, for Myself.	 42	"Go you and your brother with My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), and do not, you both, slacken and become weak in My Remembrance.	 43	"Go, both of you, to Firaun (Pharaoh), verily, he has transgressed (all bounds in disbelief and disobedience and behaved as an arrogant and as a tyrant).	 44	"And speak to him mildly, perhaps he may accept admonition or fear Allah."	 45	They said: "Our Lord! Verily! We fear lest he should hasten to punish us or lest he should transgress (all bounds against us)."	 46	He (Allah) said: "Fear not, verily! I am with you both, hearing and seeing.	 47	"So go you both to him, and say: Verily, we are Messengers of your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and torment them not; indeed, we have come with a sign from your Lord! And peace will be upon him who follows the guidance!	 48	Truly, it has been revealed to us that the torment will be for him who denies (believes not in the Oneness of Allah, and in His Messengers, etc.), and turns away.(from the truth and obedience of Allah)"	 49	Firaun (Pharaoh) said: "Who then, O Moosa (Moses), is the Lord of you two?"	 50	(Moosa (Moses)) said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each thing its form and nature, then guided it aright."	 51	(Firaun (Pharaoh)) said: "What about the generations of old?"	 52	(Moosa (Moses)) said: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord is neither unaware nor He forgets, "	 53	Who has made earth for you like a bed (spread out); and has opened roads (ways and paths etc.) for you therein; and has sent down water (rain) from the sky. And We have brought forth with it various kinds of vegetation.	 54	Eat and pasture your cattle, (therein); verily, in this are proofs and signs for men of understanding.	 55	Thereof (the earth) We created you, and into it We shall return you, and from it We shall bring you out once again.	 56	And indeed We showed him (Firaun (Pharaoh)) all Our Signs and Evidences, but he denied and refused.	 57	He (Firaun (Pharaoh)) said: "Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moosa (Moses)?	 58	"Then verily, we can produce magic the like thereof; so appoint a meeting between us and you, which neither we, nor you shall fail to keep, in an open wide place where both shall have a just and equal chance (and beholders could witness the competition)."	 59	(Moosa (Moses)) said: "Your appointed meeting is the day of the festival, and let the people assemble when the sun has risen (forenoon)."	 60	So Firaun (Pharaoh) withdrew, devised his plot and then came back.	 61	Moosa (Moses) said to them: "Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you completely by a torment. And surely, he who invents a lie (against Allah) will fail miserably."	 62	Then they debated with one another what they must do, and they kept their talk secret.	 63	They said: "Verily! These are two magicians. Their object is to drive you out from your land with magic, and overcome your chiefs and nobles.	 64	"So devise your plot, and then assemble in line. And whoever overcomes this day will be indeed successful."	 65	They said:"O Moosa (Moses)! Either you throw first or we be the first to throw?"	 66	(Moosa (Moses)) said: "Nay, throw you (first)!" Then behold, their ropes and their sticks, by their magic, appeared to him as though they moved fast.	 67	So Moosa (Moses) conceived a fear in himself.	 68	We (Allah) said: "Fear not! Surely, you will have the upper hand.	 69	"And throw that which is in your right hand! It will swallow up that which they have made. That which they have made is only a magicians trick, and the magician will never be successful, no matter whatever amount (of skill) he may attain."	 70	So the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Haroon (Aaron) and Moosa (Moses)."	 71	(Firaun (Pharaoh)) said: "Believe you in him (Moosa (Moses)) before I give you permission? Verily! He is your chief who taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you on the trunks of date-palms, and you shall surely know which of us (I (Firaun Pharaoh) or the Lord of Moosa (Moses) (Allah)) can give the severe and more lasting torment."	 72	They said: "We prefer you not over the clear signs that have come to us, and to Him (Allah) Who created us. So decree whatever you desire to decree, for you can only decree (regarding) this life of the world.	 73	"Verily! We have believed in our Lord, that He may forgive us our faults, and the magic to which you did compel us. And Allah is better as regards reward in comparison to your (Firauns (Pharaoh)) reward, and more lasting (as regards punishment in comparison to your punishment)."	 74	Verily! Whoever comes to his Lord as a Mujrim (criminal, polytheist, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah and His Messengers, sinner, etc.), then surely, for him is Hell, therein he will neither die nor live.	 75	But whoever comes to Him (Allah) as a believer (in the Oneness of Allah, etc.), and has done righteous good deeds, for such are the high ranks (in the Hereafter),	 76	Adn (Edn) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), under which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever: such is the reward of those who purify themselves ((by abstaining from all kinds of sins and evil deeds) which Allah has forbidden and by doing all that which Allah has ordained)).	 77	And indeed We inspired Moosa (Moses) (saying): "Travel by night with Ibadi (My slaves) and strike a dry path for them in the sea, fearing neither to be overtaken (by Firaun (Pharaoh)) nor being afraid (of drowning in the sea)."	 78	Then Firaun (Pharaoh) pursued them with his hosts, but the sea-water completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.	 79	And Firaun (Pharaoh) led his people astray, and he did not guide them.

text: I've taught the bible for over 20 years. And I am appalled at how inaccurate this reenactment is. I was a huge fan of Ridley Scott's work... until this.  This account in history is a classic gem, not because of how its rendered, or who is telling it; but its a gem because of what actually happened as recorded.  I hoped Scott was going to at least present the exodus with awe in the genius of his skill, but he butchered the epic! I guess this is what we get when you let a science-fiction master retell history :(

text: And has the story of Moses reached you? When he saw a fire and  said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire;  perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some  guidance." And when he came to it, he was called, "O  Moses, Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you  are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.    And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].  Indeed, I am Allah . There is no other deity except Me, so  worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance. Indeed, the  Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be  recompensed according to that for which it strives.So do not let  one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his  desire, for you [then] would perish.    And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?" He said, "It is my  staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I  have therein other uses." [ Allah ] said, "Throw it down, O  Moses." So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving  swiftly.[ Allah ] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it  to its former condition.And draw in your hand to your side; it  will come out white without disease - another sign,That We may  show you [some] of Our greater signs.    Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."    [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]  And ease for me my task And untie the knot from my tongue That  they may understand my speech. And appoint for me a minister from  my family - Aaron, my brother. Increase through him my strength  And let him share my task That we may exalt You much And remember  You much. Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing." - Holy Quran sura 20 ayat 9 to 35.
